From: "kentlbeck" <kentbeck@...>
> History, in part. Assert and TestCase were once a single class. Then
> we noticed that assert* and fail* didn't depend on any instance
> state, so we could make them into their own class. By making them
> static we could make them easily accessible outside test cases
> without any cost within.
>
> Can you write up the behavior you'd like to see as a test case?
> Perhaps it is possible to satisfy all constraints.

I'd like to see assertions as instance methods too, but so I can change
the error reporting not the behaviour. The default message for
assertEquals can be improved for long, complicated strings but I have no
access through the API to the layout code.

A proposal:

given that a class is effectively a Singleton (in a grown up language
like Smalltalk it actually is), how about having the static Assert
methods delegate to a singleton instance that implements them? Then I
can change the behaviour by changing the Singleton, but the default will
still work. e.g.

public static void Assert.assertTrue("message", aCondition) {
    Assert.singleton().assertTrue((message, aCondition);
}

S.
